categories.title: ElizaOS Development Updates and Community Discussions - January 8-9, 2026

content.text: Token Utility and Migration Concerns: Community members raised questions about ElizaOS token utility within the ecosystem, asking why it is not being used for payments or gas fees. Users expressed confusion about the token's purpose beyond rewards. Migration issues were discussed, with some users reporting problems migrating AI16Z tokens purchased before November 2025. Korean exchange delistings were mentioned, with Bithumb, Coinone, and Korbit announcing termination of trading support for AI16Z/ElizaOS due to transparency concerns and failure to disclose material information appropriately. Team members clarified that migration support is available through dedicated channels.

Technical Development and Infrastructure: Shaw announced Eliza 2.0 development, which will come in TypeScript, Rust, and Python with FFI plugin interop between languages. The new version will have no API, no server, no CLI, and no projects - just an extremely Claude-friendly documented runtime with same abstractions in three languages and examples for common use cases. A branch is already up. Jin discussed building context graphs from decision traces, noting ElizaOS has a strong data foundation to build AI agents that can help as collaborators. Daily, weekly, and monthly insights generated from agentic workflows are high quality and need integration into last mile applications. The BountyBoard project using Eliza was shared. Jin is looking for collaborators to experiment with converting ElizaOS plugins into skills for interoperability with other agent tools, testing with Discord and blockchain plugins.

Jeju Platform and Layer 2 Development: Community members discussed the Jeju platform, explaining it is named after a Korean island typically used for testing new technology before rolling out to the rest of Korea. The pronunciation is similar to the ge in George followed by joo. Jeju is described as a layer 2 that is decentralized and focused on powering AI apps, connecting everything Eliza is building. It was compared to a decentralized marketplace application running on Jeju, described as an appstore for agents. A space with Solana Foundation, PayAI, and Quantu was announced for January 13th at 7pm UTC to discuss 8004 and its utilization by Eliza Cloud.

AI Agent Applications and Data Collection: Discussion emerged about building AI agents that can monitor mental health through phone interactions, referencing Behavidence's Dopa One algorithm that monitors brain dopamine levels through mobile phones and wearable devices. The technology can detect ADHD, anxiety, and depression patterns. Community members suggested integrating this into a future ElizaOS phone app. Ideas were shared about collecting real-world data for LLM training, including using motion capture suits for various professions like fishing, cooking, and even battlefield applications. The concept of paying people for their data through reputation points was discussed. A trans detector AI agent was jokingly proposed for dating apps.

ElizaCloud Platform Updates: Users reported that ElizaCloud app creator functionality was experiencing operation failures. Team members confirmed the feature is working and is an early feature. A billing page was added to the platform allowing users to top up credits. Documentation site was temporarily down. Community members discussed deploying via containers and whether to use Pglite or PostgreSQL.

Advanced Development Techniques: Developers discussed using MiniMax M2 for coding with interleaved thinking for long-running tasks. Skills-based architecture was explored, with developers working on converting plugins into skills with markdown instructions and deterministic scripts. Challenges include getting Claude to use skills without explicit instructions, with solutions involving hooks. Workflows for chaining specialized skills were discussed, such as collecting information, filling PDFs, storing files, and displaying results. A VPS running Claude code with Kimi K2 accessible via Happy on iOS was demonstrated. Jin announced exciting updates coming to the ElizaOS leaderboard with a blog post as part 2 of The Meritverse concept.

Community Engagement and Off-Topic Discussions: Community members shared personal anecdotes and engaged in casual conversation about gaming, particularly RuneScape and GTA 6. Discussions touched on social and political topics, with members emphasizing the importance of staying positive and focusing on what can be controlled. Humor and camaraderie were evident throughout the conversations, with members sharing memes and gifs. The community showed support for each other during medical visits and personal challenges.

On January 8-9, 2026, ElizaOS made significant progress in expanding its plugin ecosystem and enhancing core functionality. The plugin registry grew with the addition of the @kamiyo/eliza plugin and the @zane-archer/plugin-aimo-router plugin. Major improvements were made to the plugin-sql module, including Neon serverless database support and enhanced Row-Level Security (RLS), with fixes for pgcrypto extension installation with PGLite. The plugin-twitter repository implemented OAuth2 PKCE authentication for enhanced security and backward compatibility. A critical bug fix enabled comprehensive hot reload functionality for backend development, streamlining the development workflow. Testing for plugin-sql was strengthened by integrating withEntityContext() into RLS tests and adding ENABLE_DATA_ISOLATION=true to CI. Work also began on a V2.0.0 release and build performance optimizations through TurboRepo configurations.

Multiple UI/UX and functionality issues were identified for the elizaos/eliza repository. These included inconsistent box sizes in the UI, intermittent failures with the web search feature, and the need to default agent names to start with a capital letter on mobile in the agent builder. Content updates were needed for both the agent edit interface and agent builder. Additional issues focused on refining input fields for personality traits and topics of interest by removing the '+' button, enhancing visibility and clarity of public/private agent statuses in the dashboard, making the 'Sign up for free' prompt in agent messages a clickable hyperlink, and redirecting users back to their previous agent chat session after login/signup.

Planning commenced for an MMORPG-style character system for the leaderboard API in the elizaos.github.io repository. This feature expansion includes implementing a full Orders & Evolution class tree with progression paths, allowing users to choose their evolution path at tier thresholds, tracking class evolution history for rich profile lore display, adding a unique visual identity system for each Order, allowing class respec with history preservation for lore purposes, and making character class thresholds configurable via config/example.json. An additional issue was raised to extend the grouped organization/repository format to day, week, and month summaries.
